other_tests.procedure_name: Exercise Myocardial Perfusion Imaging Stress Test
other_tests.findings: Patient exercised for 8 minutes and 8 seconds, achieving 10.1 METS and a peak heart rate of 150 bpm. The ECG revealed 1-mm ST depressions with T-wave inversions in leads V2 through V4. The myocardial perfusion imaging showed a left ventricular ejection fraction of 61% with a moderate-sized, reversible perfusion defect involving the anterior wall.

Demonstrated 80% stenosis in the left anterior descending coronary artery at the first diagonal, an 80% complex lesion in the left circumflex artery, and a 60% stenosis in the proximal right coronary artery.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Findings indicate progression to 3-vessel CAD of moderate severity.

other_tests.findings: Revealed complete thrombotic occlusion of the left anterior descending coronary artery at the site of the previous PCI.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Indicates a complication of stent thrombosis post-PCI.

other_tests.findings: Demonstrated elevated residual platelet reactivity with a PRU of 280 U.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Follow-up testing in 2 weeks confirmed appropriate levels of platelet inhibition with a PRU of 147 U.

other_tests.findings: Follow-up echocardiogram revealed anterior hypokinesis and an estimated ejection fraction of 45%.
